text: Tap @ at source. Pours hazy orange with a white head, Aroma is loads of fruits and bready mats, citrusy, loads of minerals, slight note of yeast. Taste is soft on the tounge, quite oliy in good way, loads of fruity charater and minerals. Superb

Draft at Zoiglstube Kramer-Wolf.
Almost none existent head. Malty with a high roasted aroma. The roasted taste malt milder in the taste with a firm bitterness and small caramel touch.

Draft at Zoiglstube Kramer-Wolf: Orangish golden with some haze. Broken, nonuniform white head. Clean and enticing aroma of minerals, airy phenols, lemon cookie, aniseed hoppiness, marmalade, honeysuckle and dusty, claylike yeast. Brisk, slightly spritzy carbonation. Bracing minerals link up with lively hop acids and sweet honeyed toast on initial sip. Fluffy underpinning of pils malt supports the weightier cookie notes. Very ripe and nearly "green" hoppiness infuses the body with an abundance of nectar, while peach puree esters bump up the succulence. Lemony oils sizzle as they disperse their elegant, mouthwatering juices. Spicy, tealike hop bitterness continually provides perfect balance, with hints of lemon beneath. Saliva-inducing long-boil piecrust flavors emerge from the deep and refined pils malt. Staunch minerals bring more firmness to the notably lean body. Malt supplements the leanness with a host of body-building starches and rich cookie. Finishes dry, haylike, and dusty, with subtle marmalade stickiness capped with an abundance of oily hop nectar and mild melanoidin presence. Belches beautifully, as rustic sulfur and peppery phenols appear late. A Hallertau-charged lemon and flower BOMB that juggles elegance and rusticity as adeptly as any Zoigl to be found in Oberfalz. Top-tier stuff right here!
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: on tap at kramer wolf. rich shade of caramel orange with a persistent bubbly head; aroma of menthol, passionfruit vine, chalk, toffee apple; fresh hop presence - grassy, menthol, still mineral water, caramel, decent bitterness. perfect session beer, was hard to leave after only 2 glasses

Draught @ Zoiglstube Kramer-Wolf, Tirschenreuther Strasse 4, Falkenberg, Bavaria Germany 95685. [ As Kommunbrauerei Falkenberg Kramer Wolf Zoigl ].Clear medium yellow amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, straw, light to moderate hoppy, grass. Initial flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter, finish flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, dry, hoppy, sweet malt, crispy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140511]

Draft at Zoiglstube Kramer-Wolf in Falkenberg, from the front of a barrel but likely a bladder or line to keg. Hazy gold with a large bubbled white head. Clean, semi sweet with pronounced bread crustiness, a strong core of toasted grain livened by apricot jam Noble hoppiness. Herbal / floral touches with quiet sulfuric mineral character. Medium bitterness and medium+ acid, its hearty and rustic while staying clean, delivered by fine, creamy carbonation leading to a rich, lengthy malt sugar finish. Savory with lip smacking crispness and lingering nuttiness of shaved almond and caramel-drizzled pastries. Stellar Zoiglbier from Kramer-Wolf, the absolute winner of the three available in Falkenberg.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2017 Draught @ Kramer Wolf, Falkenberg. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Grassy crisp and dry flavor. Dry, bitter - really clean and straight forwarded hoppy. Waaauw. Amazing! Impressive at 10 in the morning! Next time I will drink more than 1 seidla. Re-rate April 17. This time 3 seidlas before 12 o clock:-) Amazing place and locals. The beer, waitress, brewer and locals..   4,1-4,3
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Very inviting aroma of fresh herbal and grassy hops, grainy and bready malt. Crisp, sweetish, malty flavour with herbal hops, and faint hints of yeast and DMS

Würziger, sehr frischer Antrunk, stark süffig. Untertönig agiert durchgehend eine leichte Karamellnote, gefolgt von einer kräftigeren Herbe. Weiterhin sehr frisch, eher mild. Bedingt malzig. Herber Ausklang mit leichter Würze. /11/10/10//11

Draft at Kramer Wolf.  Sweet barley malt aroma with a hint of hops.  Hazy golden yellow color with nice head.  Sweet barley malt and lightly bitter herbal hops flavor.  Nice body.  Too bad I had to drive - would have loved to stay here all day.

Draught at Kramer-Wolf, Falkenberg: Golden to deep golden, visible carbonation, hazy with a stable creamy white head; fresh, light hoppy nose (freshly mowed hay); light to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, creamy MF; slightly lingering, soft hoppy finish. Great.......
Cloudy, not much head. Dull straw colour.  The nose is malty, slightly herbal, very minerally and fairly carbonated. Has some dry hop and a decent pale malt character.  Good zoigl, very rustic.

Zoigl @ Kramer Wolf. Is a hazy dark gold with a thick white head that disappears relatively fast. Fresh hoppy aroma smells grassy, earthy, and woody. The palate is minerally and a little fizzy, highly carbonated. Minerals on the tongue. Nicely hopped brew with a bright malt character and some salt.
